en:
Paidia (labelled), standing profile to the right, bent at her waist,
      wearing a short sleeved chiton, a sphendone, a beaded necklace, and bead earrings, reaches
      both arms to the right, having just pushed Himeros (labelled) (nude and white), seated profile
      to right in a swing (rising to the right), supported by white strings, which he holds with
      both hands, while he reaches his bent legs forward, to the right, wearing a red taenia in his
      hair.

<bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 7.141-42 s.v. Paidia no. 7, pl. 95 (A.
      Kossatz-Deissmann); <bibl>Shapiro 1993</bibl>, 119, 181, 244 no. 57, figs. 73,
      140; D. Vanhove ed., Le Sport dans la Grce antique (exhibition, Brussels 1992) no 38;
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 5.426 s.v. Himeros no. 15, pl. 300 (A. Hermary);
      <bibl>Burn 1987</bibl>, 92; <bibl>Lezzi-Hafter 1976</bibl>, 49 n. 193
      pl. 172a, c-d; <bibl>Froning 1971</bibl>, 11; <bibl>Hibbs 1961</bibl>
      64, fig. 69; <bibl>Mtzger 1951</bibl>, 54 no. 35 pl. 5.1; <bibl>Hoppin
      1919</bibl>, 2.288 no. 30; <bibl>Nicole 1908</bibl>, 86 no. 12;

      attischen Vasenmalerei,"" <hi rend="ital">JdI</hi> 9 (1894) 62 no. 32; P. Ducati
      in A. Baumeister ed., Denkmler des klassischen Altertums zur rluterung des Lebens der Griechen
      und Rmer in Religion, Kunst und Sitte 3 (Munich 1888) 1571 fig. 1632 (drawing); T. Lau, H.

      Gerhard, "Musei e Monumenti. L'altalena in un vaso dipinto," <hi
      rend="ital">BdI</hi> 1829, 78-79.
Himeros on a swing, pushed by Paidia
